Class BinaryNumber

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConvertToDecimal

    public class BinaryNumber
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConvertToDecimal
    S03 - Convert binary, octal and hexadecimal to decimal This class convert binary number (base 2) to decimal number (base 10).

    • Method Detail

      • checkValid

        public boolean checkValid()
        This method check a number that is a valid binary number or not by using the indexOf function (only contains 0 or 1).
        Specified by:
        checkValid in interface ConvertToDecimal
        Returns:
        A result that show that the number is a valid binary number or not.

      • convert

        public int convert()
        This method convert the valid binary number to decimal number. Converting a number from binary (base 2) to decimal (base 10) is based on calculating the value of each digit in the binary number, with each digit multiplied by a power of 2, based on its position from right to left (starting at 0). For example: 1011(2) = 1*2^3 + 0*2^2 + 1*2^1 + 1*2^0 = 11(10)
        Specified by:
        convert in interface ConvertToDecimal
        Returns:
        A decimal number that have been converted.

      • printData

        public java.lang.String printData()
        Print out the result convert the binary number to decimal number.
        Specified by:
        printData in interface ConvertToDecimal
        Returns:
        the string "Decimal number is: " + value of the decimal number.
